initial_story:
You are certainly no friend of mine. You have accused me of lying about what you had said, and run away when I proved by actual quotation that the accusation was false. We both know that, even though you praise humility, you are not humble enough to apologize.

 You sneered at my combat experience, saying "A lot of so called "combat veterans" of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" An actual friend would not have written such things.

No, you are no friend of mine, you ignorant, arrogant, hypocritical blow-hard. You should be able to guess that I do not feel friendly towards you
stories:
I would like to take the opportunity to express my gratitude for your friendship. However, I am disappointed by your conduct in recent weeks. You have accused me of lying, and when I presented evidence to prove that the accusation was false, you ran away. This is not the behavior of a friend.

Furthermore, you have insulted my combat experience, stating that "A lot of so called "combat veterans" of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" These statements are uncalled for and unfriendly.

As a result of these actions, I do not feel friendly towards you.

I appreciate your friendship, but I am upset by your recent behavior. You accused me of lying and then fled when I presented evidence that contradicted your accusation. This is not what friends do.

Additionally, you have disparaged my combat experience, claiming that "A lot of so called 'combat veterans' of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" These comments were uncalled for and unfriendly.

Due to these actions, I no longer feel friendly towards you.

Dear Friend,
I hope this letter finds you well. I wanted to reach out and address the recent disagreement we had. I was disappointed when you cut short our conversation after I presented evidence to support my point of view. I had expected a more constructive and open-minded approach to our discussion.

I would also like to apologize for my comments about your military service. It was inappropriate for me to make such remarks, and I did not intend to offend or hurt you in any way. Please accept my sincerest apologies for any distress my words may have caused you.

In light of these events, I understand that our friendship may no longer be as easy and comfortable as it once was. I am sorry if my actions have contributed to this situation. If you feel the same, I would like to take this opportunity to offer you my heartfelt gratitude for the time we shared together.

I wish you all the best in your future endeavors.
